args:
Determine whether this NHTSA investigation summary is relevant to the Washington Post. Return `{"result": true}` or `{"result": false}`
content: Low-pressure fuel pump failure

The Office of Defects Investigation (ODI) has received 6 consumer complaints alleging low-pressure fuel pump failure in model year (MY) 2021 Ford Bronco vehicles. Consumers have reported that the failure occurred while driving, without warning, and resulted in a complete loss of motive power with no ability to reengage the engine. The reports indicated that the low-pressure fuel pump was replaced following the incident.Ford has acknowledged that the same low-pressure fuel pump in the MY 2021 Ford Bronco is equipped on multiple Ford/Lincoln models. The scope of this this investigation will inquire about all Ford/Lincoln models equipped with this low-pressure fuel pump.ODI is opening this Preliminary Evaluation (PE) to determine the scope and severity of the potential problem and to fully assess the potential safety-related problems. To review the ODI reports cited in the Opening Resume ODI Report Identification Number document, go to NHTSA.gov.nan

Number of Units Affected: nan
